div.l: He seyde I trowe the Clerkys were a ferde
Yet kan a Millere make a Clerkys berde
For alle here art Â· yhe late hem goon hire weye
Lo where he goth / yhe lete the children pleye
They gete hym noght so lightly by my croun
These sely clerkys ronne vp and doun
With keep kepe / stande stande / Iossa warderer
Ga swyftly thow / and I shal kepe hym here
But shortly tyl that it was verray nyght
They koude nat though they dede al hire myght
Hire Capul cacche / he renne alway so faste
Til in a diche they caught hym atte laste
Wery and weet as beest is in the reyn
Comth sely Iohn / and with hym comth Aleyn
Allas quod Iohn / the day that I was born
Now arne we dryuen / til hethyng and til scorn
Oure corn is stoln / men wole vs foles calle
Bothe the wardeyn and oure felawis alle
And namely the Milnere weillaway
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he goth by the way
Toward the Mille / and bayard in his hand
The Milnere sittyng by the fure he fand
For it was nyght and ferther myght they noght
But for the loue of god / they hym by soght
Of herberwe and of ease / as for hire peny
The Millere seide a geyn if ther be eny
Swiche as it is / yet shal ye haue youre part
Myn hous is streyt / but ye han lerned art
Ye kan by argumentz make a place
A Mile brood of twenty feet of space
Lat see now / if this place may suffise
Or make it rome with speche as is youre gyse
Now Symound seide this Iohn / by Seynt Cutberd
Ay is thow mery and that is faire answerd

l.hi: I haue harde seide / men shall take of twa thynges
Swilke as he fyndes / or take swilke as he brynges

div.l: But specially I pray the hoost dere
Gete vs som mete and drynke and make good chere
And we wolle payen trewly atte fulle

l.hi: With empty hand men may no haukes tulle
